title: 32nd Army (Soviet Union)
text:
The 32nd Army was a formation of the <a href="Soviet%20Army">Soviet Army</a> during <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>. The army was formed twice during the war, disbanded as part of the post-war demobilization and then reformed in 1969 to protect the Soviet-Chinese border.
First Formation.
The army was formed on 16 July 1941 in the <a href="Moscow%20Military%20District">Moscow Military District</a> near the cities of <a href="Naro-Fominsk">Naro-Fominsk</a>, <a href="Kubinka">Kubinka</a>, and the settlement of <a href="Dorokhovo%2C%20Ruzsky%20District%2C%20Moscow%20Oblast">Dorokhovo</a>. The army was formed with four divisions of <a href="Moscow">Moscow</a> Militia. The assigned units included the <a href="2nd%20Rifle%20Division%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">2nd</a>, <a href="29th%20Rifle%20Division%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">7th</a>, <a href="8th%20Rifle%20Division%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">8th</a>, <a href="140th%20Rifle%20Division%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">13th</a> Moscow Militia divisions. In addition, on 20 July 1941, <a href="11th%20Guards%20Rifle%20Division">18th Moscow People's Militia Divisions</a> was assigned to the Army at positions west of Moscow. The 18th had a strength of 10,000.
On 18 July the army was incorporated into the Moscow line of defense and took up defensive positions in the vicinity of <a href="Karacharovo%2C%20Moscow%20Oblast%2C%20Russia">Karacharovo</a>. On 30 July the army was assigned to the <a href="Reserve%20Front">Reserve Front</a>. On 1 October, the army included the <a href="2nd%20Rifle%20Division%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">2nd Rifle Division</a>, <a href="8th%20Rifle%20Division%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">8th Rifle Division</a>, <a href="29th%20Rifle%20Division%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">29th Rifle Division</a> and the <a href="140th%20Rifle%20Division%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">140th Rifle Division</a>. It also included the 685th Corps Artillery Regiment, 533rd Antitank Artillery Regiment, 877th Antitank Artillery Regiment, 200th Naval Artillery Battalion and the 36th Antiaircraft Artillery Battalion.
On 3 October the army was heavily engaged in <a href="Vyazma%20Defensive%20Operation">a defensive battle</a> against German forces advancing on <a href="Vyasma">Vyazma</a> as part of the northern wing of <a href="Operation%20Typhoon">Operation Typhoon</a>. On 5 October the army was reassigned to the <a href="Western%20Front%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">Western Front</a> and two days later along with the <a href="16th%20Army%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">16th</a>, <a href="19th%20Army%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">19th</a>, <a href="20th%20Army%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">20th</a> and <a href="24th%20Army%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">24th Armies</a> were encircled by the German <a href="4th%20Army%20%28Wehrmacht%29">4th</a> and <a href="9th%20Army%20%28Wehrmacht%29">9th Armies</a> and <a href="3rd%20Panzer%20Group">3rd</a> and <a href="4th%20Panzer%20Group">4th Panzer Group</a>s. The 32nd Army was disbanded on 12 October 1941. Small elements of the army were able to break out of the encirclement and were assigned to the <a href="16th%20Army%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">16th</a> and <a href="19th%20Army%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">19th Armies</a>.
Second Formation.
<a href="STAVKA">STAVKA</a> ordered the army reformed on 2 March 1942. The reformation was completed on 10 March 1942. The army was formed from the Medvezhegorshaya and Maselskaya Operational Groups of the <a href="Karelian%20Front">Karelian Front</a>. On 1 April 1942 the army was composed of:
Until the end of May 1944 the 32nd Army defended the frontier in the <a href="Medvezhyegorsky%20District">Medvezhyegorsky District</a> and from 21 July to 9 August the army participated in the <a href="Vyborg%E2%80%93Petrozavodsk%20Offensive%23Svir.E2.80.93Petrozavodsk%20Offensive">Svir-Petrozavodsk Offensive</a>, when part of the army reached the Finish border in the vicinity of Longonvara. On 15 November 1944 the 32nd Army was put into the <a href="Reserve%20of%20the%20Supreme%20High%20Command">Reserve of the Supreme High Command</a> ("<a href="Stavka">Stavka</a>" Reserve) and on 21 April 1945 was directly subordinated to the "Stavka".

The army was disbanded in August 1945.
Third Formation.
This army was reformed using the command staff of the <a href="1st%20Army%20Corps%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">1st Army Corps</a> in 1969 when the <a href="Central%20Asian%20Military%20District">Central Asian Military District</a> was reestablished to protect the Soviet-Chinese border.

In March 1988 32nd Army became 1st Army Corps, and then in 1991 (June 1991) 40th Army was reformed at <a href="Semipalatinsk">Semipalatinsk</a>.
The army was redesignated on 4 June 1991 as the <a href="40th%20Army%20%28Soviet%20Union%29">40th Army</a>.
